title: Sampler, 1800
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser Martin. Bought by Mrs. Wiltbank.
dimensions:
Frame H x W: 88.9 x 41 cm (35 x 16 1/8 in.) double sided
Actual piece is 70 inches long, folded double
creditline: Gift of Myra M. and William H. Mathers
description:
Long white linen towel embroidered in red and blue with prayers for Rosh Hoshonna and other holidays, and the order of Seder in squares. In Hebrew.

Kiddush for Rosh Hashonah

Blessed art thou, O Lord our God, King of the universe, who hast chosed us from all peoples and exalted us above all tongues, and sanctified us by thy commandments. And thou has given us in love, O Lord our God, this Day of Memorial, a day of blowing the Shofar, an holy convocation, as a memorial of the departure from Egypt. For thou hast chosen us and hast sanctified us above all nations; and thy word in truth and endureth forever. Blessed art thou, O Lord, King over all the earth, who sanctifiest Israel and the Day of Memorial. 
Faiber Edel of K. W. Sh. 
Yuda Hanowah Munster
1800
I will wash my hands in innocency (Psalms 26, 6)

tombstone.epitaph:
